CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 7, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "High Stepper - As in past, the Soho celebration was interracial on the Fourth. Several white units, such as the above, participated in the big parade through the Hill District.  Other units included the American Legion, Elks, Auxiliary Police, Red Cross, and the Indiantown Gap Band. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Young woman holding flag, followed by majorettes and marching band in parade, with women and men standing on either side of street, for Fourth of July celebration by Soho Community Association
